model.arena.entities

Interface Entities

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Hero
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Bullet, EntitiesImpl, HeroImpl

    public interface Entities
    This interface describes any entities that are in the @Arena. Each entity is different from another on the basis of its fields which determine his status. Here is used the composition of some component that are builded with the Strategy Pattern. An entity can has or not a specific field. In this idea we can have static entities that can shoot like tower and dynamic entities that cannot shoot like platform or a ground that can hurt at the contact.
    Author:
    josephgiovanelli

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Entities.Builder
      This tool allow you to create an entity like a "stream" and do the right control in order to instance the right entity that you want and call the right constructor of the implementation of Entities.

    • Method Detail

      • getCode

        int getCode()
        Each entities in unique so has a unique code.
        Returns:
        : the unique code that you can ask.

      • getPosition

        Position getPosition()
        Each entities has a position otherwise it isn't in the arena.
        Returns:
        : the position that ypu ask.

      • setPosition

        void setPosition(Point point,
                 Directions direction)
        The method that allow you to change the position of the monster in next time or in a collision.
        Parameters:
        point - : the position consist of a point.
        direction - : the position consist of a direction.

      • getLifeManager

        LifeManager getLifeManager()
        Any entity has a manager of a life. Some has a life and then dead but some are immortal like the ground.
        Returns:
        : the LifeManager that manage the life.

      • getMovementManager

        java.util.Optional<MovementManager> getMovementManager()
        An entity can be static or dynamic. If is static this field is empty, otherwise is a @MovementManager that use the Strategy Pattern. In this architecture the Inheritance is moved in the fields of the entities.
        Returns:
        : the MovementManager that you ask.

      • getShootManager

        java.util.Optional<ShootManager> getShootManager()
        An entity can be firing or not. If is not firing this field is empty, otherwise is a @ShootManager that use the Strategy Pattern. In this architecture the Inheritance is moved in the fields of the entities.
        Returns:
        : the ShootManager that you ask.

      • getContactDamage

        java.util.Optional<java.lang.Integer> getContactDamage()
        An entity can be dangerous or not. If is not dangerous this field is empty, otherwise there is a number that determinate the contact damage.
        Returns:
        : the contact damage that you ask.

      • getAction

        Actions getAction()
        The entities has an action in a determinate moment. They can be in @STOP for an example or in @MOVE.
        Returns:
        : the action that you ask

      • setAction

        void setAction(Actions action)
        You can set the action with this method.
        Parameters:
        action - : this value is the action that you want to set.

      • accept

        void accept(EntitiesVisitor visitor)
        This method is override in any implementation of this interface in order to determinate in the entity the instance of the her.
        Parameters:
        visitor - : the @EntitiesVisitor that can call @add method in order to put the entity in the right field
